means: 似停尸房的，恐怖的，阴森的

sentence.Network_en: A charnel smell came from the chest filled with dead men's bones.
sentence.Network_cn: 一股死尸的味道从一个装满死人骨头的柜子里散出来.

sentence.Network_en: Vowed Charnel, who traveled everyplace With her slippered foot in a velvet case.
sentence.Network_cn: 查耐尔如此发誓,他到处游走带着装在天鹅绒盒子里的她穿着拖鞋的脚.

sentence.Network_en: At Simonopetra [ Monastery ] monks pile the bones of brothers in a charnel house.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这所修道院中,僧侣们把他们教友的遗骸累积在专门的存放遗骸的房子里.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, from medieval Latin carnale, neuter (used as a noun) of carnalis 'relating to flesh' (see carnal)

means.word_mean: 1. a vault or building where corpses or bones are deposited
1. gruesomely indicative of death or the dead;

sentences.sentence: "a charnel smell came from the chest filled with dead men's bones"

auth_sentence.content: Chain me with roaring bears, Or hide me nightly in a charnel house.
auth_sentence.res_content: Chain me with roaring bears, Or hide me nightly in a charnel house.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Chain me with roaring bears, Or hide me nightly in a charnel house.

auth_sentence.content: Sad charnel-house! a dismal dome, For which all mortals leave their home.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sad charnel-house! a dismal dome, For which all mortals leave their home.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sad charnel-house! a dismal dome, For which all mortals leave their home.

auth_sentence.content: It was well said that under Saddam's despotism Iraq was a charnel house above ground and a mass grave below.
